name: Garlic Butter Lemon Sous Vide Prawns

ingredients.ingredient: medium frozen white prawns, peeled and deveined

instructions: Preheat a sous vide water bath to 54°C (129°F) for tender prawns or 57°C (135°F) for a firmer texture.
If frozen, rinse prawns under cold water to remove excess ice. Pat dry.

Place prawns in a vacuum-seal bag or zip-lock freezer bag with butter, garlic, salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes (if using), olive oil, and lemon zest. Seal the bag using vacuum sealing or the water displacement method.
Sous vide the prawns for 40 minutes if frozen or 25 minutes if thawed.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Remove prawns from the bag and pour the contents into the skillet.
Sear for 30-60 seconds per side to develop a slight golden color.
Add lemon juice and toss to coat.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

storage_tips.refrigeration: Store cooked prawns in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 days.
storage_tips.freezing: Freeze raw prawns in a sealed bag for up to 3 months. Do not refreeze after sous vide cooking.
